mainEntity.name: What Web3 events are happening in major Indian cities?

acceptedAnswer.text: We list Web3 events across all major tech hubs in India. Use the city filters at the top to discover events in Bangalore (the Web3 capital with the most meetups and hackathons), Mumbai (finance and NFT-focused events), Delhi NCR (government blockchain initiatives and conferences), Pune, Hyderabad, Chennai, and 10+ other cities. Each event listing shows the exact city, date, and venue details.

mainEntity.name: How often is the event list updated?

acceptedAnswer.text: We update this directory daily to ensure you never miss an upcoming Web3 event. New meetups, hackathons, and conferences are added as soon as organizers announce them. Check the 'Last Updated' timestamp at the bottom of this page to see when we last refreshed the listings. You can also follow us on Twitter for real-time event announcements.

mainEntity.name: How do I submit my Web3 event to the listing?

acceptedAnswer.text: Click the 'Submit Event' button at the top of this page to add your Web3 meetup, hackathon, or conference. We accept events for all Indian cities — from major hubs to tier-2 cities building Web3 communities. Make sure to include the event date, city, venue details, and registration link. Events are typically added within 24 hours of submission.

mainEntity.name: Can I filter events by city?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes! Use the city filter buttons right below the header to instantly filter events. Click 'Bangalore' to see only Bangalore events, 'Mumbai' for Mumbai-only listings, 'Delhi' for NCR events, or 'Others' for events in cities like Pune, Hyderabad, Chennai, Ahmedabad, and more. The filter works instantly without reloading the page, so you can quickly compare events across different cities.

mainEntity.name: Are these Web3 events free or paid?

acceptedAnswer.text: It varies by event type. Most community meetups and networking events are free to attend. Hackathons typically have free registration but may have application processes. Conferences and multi-day events often have ticket prices, though early-bird discounts are common. Click through to the event page to see specific pricing and registration details. Many events also offer student discounts or scholarships.

mainEntity.name: How do I find hackathons versus casual meetups?

acceptedAnswer.text: Check the event titles and descriptions — hackathons usually include keywords like 'Hackathon,' 'Buidl,' 'Build-A-Thon,' or 'Ideathon' and span multiple days. Meetups are typically single-day events with titles like 'Community Meetup,' 'Networking Event,' or 'Info Session.' Workshops focus on learning specific skills and often mention technologies like Solidity, smart contracts, or specific blockchains. Conference events usually have 'Conference,' 'Summit,' or 'Conclave' in the title.

mainEntity.name: Which cities have the most Web3 activity in India?

acceptedAnswer.text: Bangalore leads by far with 60%+ of all Web3 events, hosting weekly meetups, monthly hackathons, and major conferences. Mumbai is second, focusing on DeFi, NFTs, and blockchain finance. Delhi NCR hosts government-backed blockchain initiatives and policy conferences. Emerging hubs include Pune (university-driven), Hyderabad (enterprise blockchain), and Chennai (developer communities). Tier-2 cities like Ahmedabad, Jaipur, and Kochi are rapidly growing their Web3 ecosystems.
